titleStmt.title: Letter from Anna Hempstead to Hilda Neihardt, November 18th 1930
titleStmt.author: Hempstead, Anna

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from Anna Hempstead to Hilda Neihardt, November 18th 1930

msIdentifier.repository: John G. Neihardt Center Research Library, Aly Collection

div1.fw: EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE POETS' GUILD WILLIAM ROSE BENET ANNA HEMPSTEAD BRANCH CURTIS HIDDEN PAGE HAROLD PULSIFER RIDGELY TORRENCE CHARLES HANSON TOWNE MARGARET WIDDEMER C.I. MAC COLL. HEAD WORKER OF CHRISTODORA HOUSE THE POETS' GUILD CHRISTODORA HOUSE, 147 AVENUE B NEW YORK CITY TELEPHONE, ALGONQUIN 8400 ADVISORY COMMITTEE MRS. GEORGE WOOD BACON STEPHEN P. DUGGAN, DIRECTOR, INSTITUTE OF INTERNA-TOINAL EDUCATION HARRY EMERSON FOSDICK MRS. ARTHUR CURTISS JAMES DR. ROBERT UNDERWOOD JOHNSON REED LEWIS. DIRECTOR, FOREIGN LANGUAGE INFORMATION BUREAU MRS. SETH M. MILLIKEN MRS. DWIGHT W. MORROW MRS. EDGERTON PARSONS MRS. J. ROSS STEVENSON
div1.p: from "te mont in the kitchen". "god get to us to humble duty. Each act tent he will hav eus do I habed round with stongest beauty- GF his meanest chill he asks. Terrific deer at comic tasks -

closer.note: 14 Nov. 17-1930 Dear Hilda, By the time you are an old lady what a wonderful collection you will have - I can just imagine you askign it to your grandchildren I try will say "6h grandma - to think you lived then"! thank you for you charming litter - Anna Hempsted Branch.
